lines.text: Funny how whenever people hurt your feelings, they're always doing it for your own good.
Well... I am no sex goddess, but I haven't spent my life up on a tree.
I was married, when I was young.
Married? I had no idea!
Neither did he!
Well, what can be bigger than black leather slacks? OK, I give up.
[opens the box]
A mink stole! A mink stole! And a card, too! "Your next appointment is on..."
[Julian turns the card over for her]
"As ever, Julian."

[looking at the label on the bottle]
Oh, I didn't know they made champagne in Idaho.
A man who lies cannot love.

[about to close the door]
That sounds like something out of a fortune cookie.

[after Stephanie leaves]
Dirty married bachelor!
[an Airline hostess from an Australian airline has phoned to ask if Dr Winston is free for a date that evening]
Tell her I'm grounded!

[down the phone]
I'm sorry, Miss, but Dr Winston doesn't do that kind of work any more.
[in the X-ray room, Julian reveals that he has hurt Mrs Durant - the first time he has caused a patient pain]
Pity it wasn't Mr Greenfield!
You're lucky I broke in.
Why did you?
I thought you were dying.
Well, that was the whole idea.
That's the last time you catch me saving your life.
You were going about it all wrong. I believe you're supposed to put your head in the stove.
It's a second hand stove. There were no directions.

[Describing the first time she met Julian]
He was charming, good looking, sophisticated, no sweatshirts.

[Looks down]
Sorry, I didn't know this suicide was black tie.
Really, Mrs Durant. Your teeth are more important than your hair.
You really believe that, don't you. Sad.
Mr Greenfield, please don't handle the instruments.
I was reading the other day, a dentist in New Jersey has topless nurses.
I didn't know you were interested in reading.
[She exits]

[after Julian bursts into the apartment]
I didn't know dentists made house calls.
[Toni reveals she tried to commit suicide]
You really tried to kill yourself over me?
Stupid, wasn't it?
I'm a bastard, the biggest bastard in the whole world.
Julian, please, you're starting to make it sound like bragging.
Toni, I'm going to marry you.
How do you mean, Marry?
You know, marry, with the judge, the blood test, the license, that kind of marry, right away.
But what about your wife?
My wife? I'll divorce her.
What about the children?
I'll divorce them, too.
There is something so provocative about a nurse in uniform. No frills. No adorments. Just the basic woman.

[after putting the x-ray gun into place]
Hold still, Señor Sánchez, or the basic woman is liable to x-ray your nose.
And did you get a load of that girl?
Well, I wasn't paying much attention...
When she bent over, it looked like she had her knees up inside her dress.

[Meeting on the dance floor]
Good evening, doctor.
Good evening, patient.
Hey, did you see that? He just kissed her on the neck!
Hmph! She sure likes a lot of action.
Yes, she does, doesn't she!
Right now, she's surrounded by her husband, her ex-boyfriend, her current boyfriend and maybe her future boyfriend.
If somebody doesn't stop that guy, he's gonna make love to her right in the middle of the floor.
Where were you all night?
It's all a blur, a beautiful blurry blur.
I must say, it's grotesque. A woman your age, throwing yourself at a kid like that!
And what about that eh, father-daughter thing of yours, if you don't think that's ridiculous...
Well, it's different for a man. If a man is with a younger woman it looks entirely appropriate, but when it's the other way around, it's disg...
Well, you go to your church and I'll go to mine.
Stephanie?
Doctor?
I think I'm going to kiss you.
When will you know for sure?

[They kiss passionately]
I plan to do this often.
I'll make a note to remind you.
Drink up. It'll make me look better to you.
There isn't that much wine in the world.
To our love affair.
[clinking glasses]
God forbid.
Her name is Toni Simmons.
She's alive.
What shall we drink?
Oh, let's have some of that crazy Idaho champagne.
What did she say?
It's not what she said, it's what she didn't say
Tell me what she didn't say, word for word
It's like waltzing in wet cement!
How do you like children?
Barbecued.
Did you ever have a gin and tonic made with tequila?

[Looking slightly disgusted]
Gin and tequila?
Yes. They call it the 'Mexican *Measles*'

[Correcting her]
'Missile.'
They tell me it prevents malaria.

[Talking about trying to recover his car which had been towed earlier]
I went to the police station. They told me to try a garage on the East Side. When I got there they told me to try the West Side. When I got there, it was closed. I couldn't find a cab so I had to walk home. I should have listened to my mother and become an M.D. - they let you park anywhere.
Now why don't you go back and mind your own business like everyone else in New York City?
shut up.
What were you doing, talking to that awful man?
I was getting lonesome for the sound of a human voice.
Can I have another glass of beer?
Not yours!

[after Julian reveals that he told Toni he was married]
That's such a big dirty rotten filthy lie, it has class.
[Toni realises that she's being kissed by someone other than Julian]
Who are you? What are you doing?
Mouth to Mouth resuscitation.
You were kissing me!
I lost my head!
[Greenfield has asked for free dental work for his latest girlfriend]
Don't you know any girls with straight teeth?

[pointing to Igor]
Will you give Tarzan here his electric razor?
[Julian has asked Stephanie if she would like to have a drink with him]
Are you asking me to go out?
Why? Is there someone else in that closet?
You're getting as prickly as your damn cactus!
[Igor reveals he's a writer]
You're a writer? You're the writer! The one who keeps pounding on his typewriter all night - you drive me crazy!
Why didn't you complain so I could have met you earlier?
[Miss Dickinson has pointed out there is no more room on Greenfield's tab]
Julian, I feel insulted. It isn't as if I'm planning to stick ya.
It isn't as if you're planning to pay me, either.
I'm a member of the CIA.
The CIA? I thought you were a television actor?
That's my cover. So if you ever see me in public with another girl you must pretend not to know me, or it could put my life in great danger.
Now if I hear that you've been bothering Stephanie again, I'll knock all your teeth out.
You'll just have to put them back in again.
If you work for the CIA, how come you hang around with dentists?
He's installing a miniature radio transmitor in my wisdom tooth.
What happened out there on my mink stole? - I mean the beach. I wanna know.
Oh, isn't he a marvelous dentist?
Great.
But with his talents he would have made an even better obstetrician.

[Talking to Harvey, about Toni]
I'm having a rough time. As long as I was lying to her, everything was fine. The minute I decided to do the right thing and marry her, I've had troubles. You wouldn't believe the complications. It's like waltzing in wet cement.

[after they've observed Stephanie's prowess on the dance floor]
Everything you told me about your wife was true. She's not a lady, she's a barracuda!
I don't care to discuss it anymore.
In the office, you sort of look like a large Bandaid.
